Class BookingController

java.lang.Object
com.javaoop.movie_booking_app.controller.BookingController
@Controller public class BookingController extends Object
Controller responsible for managing the booking process including seat selection, booking creation, booking history display, and booking cancellation.

This controller handles all booking-related requests for logged-in users. It interacts with services for booking management, showtime details, seat availability, and member information.

  • Constructor Details

    • BookingController

      public BookingController(BookingService bookingService, ShowtimeService showtimeService, SeatService seatService, MemberService memberService)
      Constructs a new BookingController with required service dependencies.
      Parameters:
      bookingService - service to handle booking operations
      showtimeService - service to handle showtime information
      seatService - service to handle seat details
      memberService - service to handle member information

  • Method Details

    • showSeatSelectionPage

      @GetMapping("/booking/showtime/{showtimeId}") public String showSeatSelectionPage(@PathVariable("showtimeId") Long showtimeId, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Displays the seat selection page for a given showtime.

      The method fetches the showtime by its ID, loads all seats in the related hall, determines which seats are already booked, groups seats by row for display, and prepares a booking form DTO for the view.

      Parameters:
      showtimeId - the unique ID of the showtime for which seats are to be booked
      model - Spring MVC Model to add attributes for the view
      redirectAttributes - attributes used for passing flash messages on redirect
      Returns:
      the Thymeleaf template name for seat selection page, or redirect to the homepage if showtime not found

    • processBooking

      @PostMapping("/booking/create/{showtimeId}") public String processBooking(@PathVariable("showtimeId") Long showtimeId, @Valid @ModelAttribute("bookingForm") @Valid BookingFormDto bookingForm, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult, org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Processes the seat selection form submitted by the user and attempts to create a booking.

      This method validates the form data, checks the existence of the showtime and the current user, and calls the booking service to create the booking. If errors occur, it redirects back to the seat selection page with error messages.

      Parameters:
      showtimeId - the unique ID of the showtime to book seats for
      bookingForm - DTO containing the list of selected seats by the user
      bindingResult - result of form validation checks
      model - Spring MVC Model (not typically used for redirect)
      redirectAttributes - attributes used to pass flash messages on redirect
      Returns:
      redirect URL to the booking page on success or seat selection page on failure

    • showMyBookings

      @GetMapping("/booking") public String showMyBookings(org.springframework.ui.Model model, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Displays the booking history page for the currently logged-in user.

      The method retrieves the current authenticated user's email, fetches their bookings, and adds them to the model for display. Redirects to login if user information is missing.

      Parameters:
      model - Spring MVC Model to pass bookings data to the view
      redirectAttributes - attributes used to pass flash messages on redirect
      Returns:
      the Thymeleaf template name for user's booking history or redirect to login page

    • handleBookingCancellation

      @PostMapping("/booking/cancel") public String handleBookingCancellation(@RequestParam("bookingId") Long bookingId, org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttributes)
      Handles a booking cancellation request from the logged-in user.

      Validates the user's identity, attempts to cancel the booking if it belongs to the user, and provides success or error messages accordingly.

      Parameters:
      bookingId - the ID of the booking to cancel
      redirectAttributes - attributes used to pass flash messages on redirect
      Returns:
      redirect URL back to the user's booking history page or login if user not found
